repnme.cdata!:
South Sudan - Core Fiduciary Systems
            Support Project (CFSSP)

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall outcome rating of the Core
            Fiduciary Systems Support Project for South Sudan was judged
            to be moderately satisfactory. The Bank and borrower
            performance were satisfactory. The risk to development
            outcome was moderate. Significant changes included: (a) an
            additional financing of US$ 3 million for the procurement
            component to strengthen the capacity of the Procurement
            Policy Unit of the Ministry of Finance and Economic Planning
            and to enhance the procurement functions of key Ministries,
            Departments and Agencies. Other significant changes
            included; additional financing for 5 components,
            reallocation between 3 components, 7 amendments to trust
            funds, a change to the project accounting firm component,
            substitution of  a procurement agent with a procurement
            advisor, and an extension of the closing date to March 31,
            2013.  Several lessons were learned.  External agents,
            particularly for audit and procurement, can contribute
            significantly to institutional strengthening priorities, but
            this should be accompanied by the transfer of skills in
            order to facilitate longer term capacity building.
            Implementation efficiency can be enhanced through
            flexibility on procurement procedures, and by focusing
            external agents on salient, project-related tasks rather
            than assisting on broader government functions. Depending on
            the core function(s) involved, individual consultants can
            provide more efficient and cost-effective services compared
            to firms, and may result in quicker transfer of knowledge.
            The timely appointment of Government counterparts is
            essential for efficient and successful implementation.  At
            entry, it is important to clarify objectives to stakeholders
            to avoid unrealistic expectations from the project.

repnme.cdata!:
Sudan - Core Fiduciary Systems Support
            Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the Core
            Fiduciary Systems Support Project is to put in place a
            robust framework for channeling of Multi-Donor Trust Fund
            (MDTF) and Government of South Sudan (GoSS) counterpart
            funds to provide reasonable assurance regarding the use of
            these funds. The restructuring is for additional financing
            of US $ 1.3 million to support the external audit component
            of the project in the audit of MDTF and Republic of South
            Sudan financial statements. This will enable the project
            support all MDTF projects in implementation and closure of
            project activities. In September 2010, the project sought
            and obtained an extension to the project's closing date
            from June 30, 2011 to September 31, 2012; use funds from
            procurement component financed under additional financing to
            support expenditures related to accounting and auditing
            components which were originally financed under the original
            grant as well as update of the project's results
            framework. The Grant Agreement for was amended to suitably
            reflect this change.

Sudan - Core Fiduciary Systems
            Support Project : restructuring  (Vol. 2) : Data sheet
